definition: stripes of a tiger/"tiger" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 141)

sentences.english: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
sentences.chinese: 你是废弃敬畏的意，在神面前阻止敬虔的心。

sentences.english: The most valuable commentary on the Bible is a godly life.
sentences.chinese: 诠释圣经的最佳方式，就是过敬虔的生活。

sentences.english: Godliness add the content heart is the big interests.
sentences.chinese: 敬虔加上知足的心便是大利了。

sentences.english: First generation serious Christians faded in later generations.
sentences.chinese: 第一代敬虔的基督徒在后来几代中逐渐消失。

sentences.english: He was tried that his godliness might be confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 他受试炼，是为要证实他的敬虔。

sentences.english: You begin worshipfully praying by giving God your love.
sentences.chinese: 把你的爱献给神，这样开始你敬虔的祷告吧。

sentences.english: Identify Law sections that guide or direct people to take godly action.
sentences.chinese: 确定指导或指引人采取敬虔行为的律法部分。

sentences.english: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.
sentences.chinese: 别让不敬虔的人作王，免得他危害人民。

sentences.english: You can enjoy life, secure within a godly, unified family.
sentences.chinese: 你可以享受生命，在一个敬虔合一的家里安息的生活。

sentences.english: Please help me pursue godliness with contentment.
sentences.chinese: 求祢帮助我们，以知足的心追求敬虔。

sentences.english: But godliness with contentment is great gain.
sentences.chinese: 然而敬虔加上知足的心便是大利了。

sentences.english: Notice that the one requirement for receiving justification by faith is to be ungodly.
sentences.chinese: 请注意不敬虔的罪人是因信称义的一个必要条件。

sentences.english: This month we're focusing on God's guidance for flourishing families.
sentences.chinese: 这个月，我们集中思想神对于敬虔而兴旺家庭的指引。

sentences.english: They were all Godly men and filled with the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 被选出的七人都是敬虔的人，且被圣灵充满。

sentences.english: Warm, vital piety is one of the distinguishing marks of the catechism.
sentences.chinese: 热情而有活力的敬虔是这个教理问答独特的标记之一。

sentences.english: It was a very godly home into which this baby boy was born.
sentences.chinese: 经文讲述的那个小男婴，一定是生于一个敬虔的家庭。

definition: to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
variant of 眷[juan4]/to care about/to look fondly on
ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
